actions.text: RE-REFERRAL OF H.R. 2926 - Mr. Rose asked unanimous consent that the Committee on House Administration be discharged from further consideration of the bill H.R. 2926, and that the bill be re-referred to the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. Agreed to without objection.
Committee on House Administration discharged.

DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston under the authority of the order of May 21, 92 with an amendment. With written report No. 102-288.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 472.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 2730 proposed by Senator Baucus for Senator Danforth.
Amendment SP 2730 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Vento asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Message on House action received in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-355.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: To amend the Act of May 17, 1954, relating to the Jefferson National Expansion Memorial to authorize increased funding for the East Saint Louis portion of the Memorial, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Designates approximately 100 acres for the East Saint Louis extension of the Jefferson National Expansion Memorial. Repeals provisions requiring the Secretary of the Interior to approve the plan for the extension. Authorizes increased funding for land acquisition for the extension. Denies authorization of appropriations for acquisition, removal, or relocation of the grain elevator and business within the East St. Louis unit of the Memorial. Removes the present authorization ceiling on extension development. Provides that Federal funds expended for extension development may not exceed 75 percent of the actual cost of such development, with the remaining share of such costs to be provided from non-Federal funds, materials, or services, or a combination thereof. Specifies under what conditions credit towards the 25 percent match shall be given. Requires any non-Federal expenditure for acquisition, removal, or relocation of the grain elevator and business to be charged to the non-Federal cost share. Requires the Secretary of the Interior to develop a study for the Congress of alternatives to, and costs associated with, the removal of the grain elevator within the East St. Louis unit of the Memorial.

titles.title: To amend the Act of May 17, 1954, relating to the Jefferson National Expansion Memorial to authorize increased funding for the East Saint Louis portion of the Memorial, and for other purposes.
